sanskrit_verse:
ऋत्विजं यस्त्यजेद्याज्यो याज्यं चर्त्विक्त्यजेद्यदि ।
शक्तं कर्मण्यदुष्टं च तयोर्दण्डः शतं शतम् ॥ ८.३८८॥
transliteration:
ṛtvijaṁ yastyajedyājyo yājyaṁ cartviktajed yadi |
śaktaṁ karmaṇyaduṣṭaṁ ca tayordaṇḍaḥ śataṁ śatam || 8.388||
sph_interpretive_translation: He who abandons the officiating priest when capable of engaging him, and he who is abandoned by the sacrificer though competent and innocent—both incur a penalty of one hundred.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority rests in alignment with dharma-kṣetra and svadharma-siddhi
Causation arises through conscious capacity and dharmic alignment
Capacity-based responsibility demands engagement where competence exists
Restoration logic operates through completion of relational dharmic duty
Consciousness alignment requires rectification of disrupted spiritual transaction
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent_has_capacity AND duty_is_dharmically_aligned THEN abandonment_is_a_completion_failure
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating disputes involving sacred contracts or ritual obligations, the court must assess not intent or fault, but whether either party withdrew from a dharmically valid arrangement despite possessing the requisite capacity. Both parties bear symmetrical restoration obligations if neither has violated dharma.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that withdrawal from a dharmic act without cause disrupts cosmic order; anupūrvaśaḥ shows how such disruption manifests sequentially in individual and collective consciousness. Responsibility is proportional to capacity and innocence preserved. The penalty serves not punishment but energetic correction and relational rebalancing.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process for unfulfilled sacred contract
Assign responsibility assumption protocol to restore energetic balance
Engage capacity restoration mechanism for future dharmic participation
Activate integrity reintegration sequence for both parties involved
final_declaration: By the authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of all Dharma, this law stands executed. Justice flows not for vengeance but for alignment. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates eternally.
